content.question: Which of the following best explains how environmental stressors, such as wildfires, can affect biodiversity in an ecosystem?

choices.label: After an environmental stress, a genetic bottleneck may occur, which will increase genetic diversity.
Habitat diversity will increase the available niches if the landscape becomes more uniform after a disturbance.
Ecosystems with more species diversity are more likely to recover after a disturbance than ecosystems with low species diversity.
Smaller populations are less likely to go extinct than larger populations, so the species diversity will remain constant.

content.answer: Ecosystems with more species diversity are more likely to recover after a disturbance than ecosystems with low species diversity.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe environmental concepts and processes.
